TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EncryptedReference extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the , , and classes derive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference.GetXml%2A> method in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> class to write the XML values to the console.
[!code-cpp[CipherReference2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CipherReference2/CPP/example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[CipherReference2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CipherReference2/CS/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[CipherReference2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CipherReference2/VB/example.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes a class that is an abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> classes derive. Unless you have a scenario where you need to create a custom reference section in XML, use one of the inherited classes.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string uri) cil managed

Docs.param: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that points to the data to encrypt.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `uri` parameter provides information about the location of the data to be encrypted.
This constructor initializes a class that is an abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> classes derive. Unless you have a scenario where you need to create a custom reference section in XML, use one of the inherited classes.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string uri, class System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain tc) cil managed

Docs.param: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that points to the data to encrypt.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) and transform chain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is an abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> classes derive. Unless you have a scenario where you need to create a custom reference section in XML, use one of the inherited classes.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.

Docs.param: A object to add to the transform chain.
Docs.summary: Adds a object to the current transform chain of an object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the cache is valid.
Docs.value: if the cache is valid; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The cache is used to maintain the encrypted data.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlElement GetXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the XML representation of an object.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the values of the element in XML encryption.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this method to output the XML information contained in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference> object.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference.GetXml%2A> method in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> class to write the XML values to the console.
[!code-cpp[CipherReference2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CipherReference2/CPP/example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[CipherReference2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CipherReference2/CS/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[CipherReference2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CipherReference2/VB/example.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LoadXml(class System.Xml.XmlElement value) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that represents an XML element.
Docs.summary: Loads an XML element into an object.
Gets or sets a reference type.
Docs.value: The reference type of the encrypted data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is set when using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> derived classes. For example, a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> object sets this property value to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the transform chain of an object.
Docs.value: A object that describes transforms used on the encrypted data.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of an object.
Docs.value: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to indicate the location of the encrypted data.
